deck.name: C1 â€“ Advanced Vocabulary
deck.description: Advanced: sophisticated language for academic, professional, and complex social contexts.

cards.definition: to choose not to do or have something
cards.context: Several members abstained from voting.

cards.definition: to stick firmly to; to follow closely
cards.context: Employees must adhere to the company policy.
The hotel is adjacent to the train station.
She showed great strength in the face of adversity.

cards.definition: an official connection to an organization
cards.context: His affiliation with the university ended last year.

cards.definition: the consequences of a significant event
cards.context: In the aftermath of the flood, thousands were homeless.

cards.definition: loyalty to a group, leader, or cause
cards.context: She pledged her allegiance to the new organization.
The medicine helped alleviate the pain.

cards.definition: the quality of being open to more than one interpretation
cards.context: The contract was full of ambiguity.
There is ample evidence to support the claim.

cards.definition: a comparison between things that have similar features
cards.context: He drew an analogy between the brain and a computer.

cards.definition: something that deviates from what is expected
cards.context: The test result was an anomaly.

cards.definition: equipment or system used for a particular purpose
cards.context: The laboratory has sophisticated apparatus.

cards.definition: anxiety or fear about the future
cards.context: She felt a sense of apprehension before the interview.

cards.definition: based on random choice rather than reason
cards.context: The decision seemed completely arbitrary.
She is an articulate speaker.
His assertion was backed by evidence.

cards.definition: a quality or feature; to regard as caused by
cards.context: Patience is an important attribute for a teacher.

cards.definition: to make something greater by adding to it
cards.context: The company augmented its workforce.
Quick action averted a disaster.

cards.definition: to see or observe something remarkable
cards.context: Behold the beauty of the sunset.

cards.definition: to give something as a gift or honor
cards.context: The university bestowed an honorary degree.
The company breached its contract.
The instruments must be calibrated regularly.

cards.definition: to stop or come to an end
cards.context: The factory ceased production last month.

cards.definition: to find a way around an obstacle
cards.context: They tried to circumvent the regulations.

cards.definition: to persuade by force or threats
cards.context: He was coerced into signing the agreement.

cards.definition: to happen at the same time
cards.context: My holiday coincides with the conference.
The ceremony will commence at noon.
She compiled a list of recommendations.

cards.definition: to add to or complete something
cards.context: The wine complements the meal perfectly.
He tried to conceal his disappointment.

cards.definition: to admit something is true; to yield
cards.context: She conceded that the plan had flaws.

cards.definition: to form an idea; to become pregnant
cards.context: She conceived a brilliant plan.
The government condemned the attack.
Please confine your remarks to the topic.
The company consolidated its operations.
Budget constraints limited our options.
She contemplated a career change.
The evidence contradicts his testimony.

cards.definition: to come together for a meeting
cards.context: The board convened an emergency meeting.

cards.definition: to come together from different directions
cards.context: Several factors converged to cause the crisis.
Words cannot convey my gratitude.
The government took steps to curb inflation.
Appearances can deceive.
The project was deemed a success.

cards.definition: to postpone or yield to someone
cards.context: They deferred the decision until next month.

cards.definition: to represent in a picture or words
cards.context: The painting depicts a rural landscape.

cards.definition: to use up or exhaust a supply
cards.context: Overfishing has depleted ocean stocks.

cards.definition: to move into position for use
cards.context: The company deployed new technology.

cards.definition: to officially assign a name or role
cards.context: The area was designated a national park.
His health deteriorated rapidly.

cards.definition: to depart from an established course
cards.context: Do not deviate from the original plan.
She devised a strategy to win the contract.
Nothing can diminish her achievements.
Discard any food that has expired.
The company refused to disclose its profits.
The news dismayed the investors.
The police dispersed the crowd.

cards.definition: to force someone from their home or position
cards.context: The war displaced millions of people.

cards.definition: to get rid of; to arrange
cards.context: Dispose of hazardous waste properly.

cards.definition: to interrupt the normal course of
cards.context: The protest disrupted traffic for hours.

cards.definition: to cause to disappear into a liquid; to end
cards.context: Parliament was dissolved before the election.

cards.definition: to redirect to a different course
cards.context: Traffic was diverted due to the accident.
The question elicited a strong reaction.
She embarked on a new career.

cards.definition: to accept willingly; to hold closely
cards.context: The company embraced new technology.
The factory emits greenhouse gases.
The celebrity endorsed the product.
She endured months of rehabilitation.

cards.definition: to make sure rules are followed
cards.context: The police enforce the law.
Students engaged actively in the discussion.
Travel enriches your understanding of the world.

cards.definition: to involve as a necessary consequence
cards.context: The job entails a lot of traveling.
Wind and rain eroded the cliff face.

cards.definition: to increase in intensity or seriousness
cards.context: The conflict escalated quickly.
He evaded answering the question directly.

cards.definition: to represent as larger than it really is
cards.context: He tends to exaggerate his achievements.
She exerted pressure on the committee.
Oil is extracted from the ground.
He fabricated the entire story.
There is an acute shortage of nurses.
The drug has adverse side effects.

cards.definition: wealthy; having a lot of money
cards.context: They live in an affluent neighborhood.
The aggregate cost exceeded the budget.

cards.definition: having more than one meaning; unclear
cards.context: The instructions are ambiguous.
She spoke in an authoritative tone.
He presented a coherent argument.
The evidence was compelling.

cards.definition: able to exist or work together
cards.context: The software is compatible with most devices.

cards.definition: too satisfied with oneself; not worried
cards.context: Do not become complacent about safety.
Every conceivable option was considered.
A quiet environment is conducive to study.

cards.definition: following one after another without interruption
cards.context: It rained for five consecutive days.
His absence was conspicuous.
He was contemptuous of their efforts.
The witness gave a credible account.
The cumulative effect of stress can be harmful.

cards.definition: settling an issue; making decisions quickly
cards.context: The battle was a decisive victory.
The diet is deficient in vitamins.
The prisoners were subjected to degrading treatment.
Smoking is detrimental to your health.

cards.definition: able to be perceived or recognized
cards.context: There was no discernible difference.
Please be discreet about this matter.

cards.definition: designed to be thrown away after use
cards.context: Reduce your use of disposable plastic.
She organized an elaborate dinner party.
Success remained elusive.
She is an eminent scientist.
The theory is supported by empirical data.
His behavior has been erratic lately.
The jewelry is exquisite.
The plan is technically feasible.

cards.definition: inspiring fear or respect through great size or ability
cards.context: She is a formidable opponent.
Further attempts were futile.
A storm is imminent.
A judge must be impartial.
There is a sense of impending change.
There was an implicit agreement between them.
The error was inadvertent.
She has an inclination toward art.
She has become indispensable to the team.

cards.definition: existing as a permanent and essential quality
cards.context: Risk is inherent in any business venture.
The design is incredibly intricate.

cards.definition: based on feelings rather than reasoning
cards.context: The software has an intuitive interface.
Real estate can be a lucrative investment.
The improvement was only marginal.
She is meticulous in her research.
He wanted to escape his mundane routine.

cards.definition: so small as to be unimportant
cards.context: The difference in price is negligible.
The road is notorious for accidents.

cards.definition: not well known; hard to understand
cards.context: The reference was rather obscure.
Safety is of paramount importance.
Her explanation was plausible.

cards.definition: dealing with things in a practical way
cards.context: She took a pragmatic approach to the problem.

cards.definition: not safe or certain; dangerously unstable
cards.context: The company is in a precarious financial position.

cards.definition: most common or greatest in number
cards.context: English is the predominant language in the office.
Allergies are increasingly prevalent.
The book had a profound impact on me.

cards.definition: producing a lot of work or results
cards.context: She is a prolific writer.

cards.definition: expected or likely to happen in the future
cards.context: Prospective buyers viewed the house.
We reached a provisional agreement.
Several workers were made redundant.

cards.definition: able to recover quickly from difficulties
cards.context: Children are remarkably resilient.
The economy is showing robust growth.
Clean water is scarce in the region.
The regulations are very stringent.
Subsequent events confirmed our fears.

cards.definition: existing or occurring on the surface; not deep
cards.context: His understanding of the subject is superficial.

cards.definition: real and concrete; able to be touched
cards.context: We need tangible evidence of progress.
We have a tentative agreement.
Do not waste time on trivial matters.
The decision was unanimous.
We are facing unprecedented challenges.
Is this a viable business model?
There must be accountability for these decisions.
The acquisition of the company was finalized.

cards.definition: a story with a hidden meaning
cards.context: The novel is an allegory of political oppression.
She felt ambivalence about leaving.

cards.definition: a system with many complex rules
cards.context: Government bureaucracy slows decision-making.

cards.definition: something that causes an important change
cards.context: The protest was a catalyst for reform.

cards.definition: the action of forming a united whole
cards.context: The team lacked cohesion.
There were complications during the surgery.

cards.definition: an additional meaning suggested by a word
cards.context: The word "home" has warm connotations.
We reached a consensus on the plan.
There is a strong correlation between diet and health.

cards.definition: a standard by which something is judged (singular)
cards.context: Quality is the main criterion for selection.

cards.definition: a lack or shortage of something
cards.context: Iron deficiency can cause tiredness.
Environmental degradation is a serious concern.
After long deliberation, they reached a decision.
Many children live in deprivation.
The fine acts as a deterrent.

cards.definition: a difference between things that should be the same
cards.context: There is a discrepancy in the accounts.
She has a cheerful disposition.

cards.definition: a set of beliefs or principles
cards.context: The political doctrine has evolved over time.

cards.definition: the forces that produce change or movement
cards.context: The dynamics of the team have changed.

cards.definition: a serious attempt to achieve something
cards.context: Scientific endeavor has led to great discoveries.

cards.definition: fairness; the value of shares in a company
cards.context: The policy promotes equity in education.

cards.definition: a short extract from a text
cards.context: She read an excerpt from her new book.
There are many facets to this issue.

cards.definition: a mistaken belief or false argument
cards.context: That argument is based on a common fallacy.

cards.definition: conflict or disagreement; resistance between surfaces
cards.context: There is friction between the two departments.

cards.definition: a formal complaint about unfair treatment
cards.context: She filed a grievance with the HR department.
The company has a strict hierarchy.
The findings have serious implications for policy.
Tax cuts provide an incentive for investment.
Salaries increase in annual increments.
The country needs better road infrastructure.
He is a man of great integrity.

cards.definition: the act of becoming involved to change a situation
cards.context: Medical intervention saved his life.

cards.definition: the authority to apply the law
cards.context: This falls outside our jurisdiction.

cards.definition: the process of taking legal action
cards.context: The case went through years of litigation.

cards.definition: the great size or importance of something
cards.context: They did not realize the magnitude of the problem.
The government has a mandate to reform healthcare.
The symptoms are a manifestation of stress.
The company has a monopoly on the industry.

cards.definition: a seemingly contradictory statement that may be true
cards.context: It is a paradox that the busiest people often get the most done.
The movement fights for pay parity.
Be aware of the pitfalls of investing.

cards.definition: a statement assumed true as the basis for reasoning
cards.context: The argument is based on a false premise.
It is your prerogative to decide.
The prevalence of the disease has decreased.

cards.definition: the process of obtaining goods or services
cards.context: The procurement process was transparent.

cards.definition: the reasons or logical basis for something
cards.context: What is the rationale behind this decision?
You can claim reimbursement for travel expenses.

cards.definition: an unintended consequence of an action
cards.context: The decision had serious repercussions.

cards.definition: the art of persuasive speaking; language designed to persuade
cards.context: Political rhetoric often oversimplifies issues.
The country faced economic sanctions.
The plan came under close scrutiny.
National sovereignty is a sensitive issue.

cards.definition: a person with an interest in a business
cards.context: All stakeholders were consulted.

cards.definition: the path followed by a moving object; direction of development
cards.context: Her career trajectory has been impressive.

cards.definition: a state of great disturbance or confusion
cards.context: The country was in political turmoil.
The task was challenging, albeit rewarding.
He succeeded by virtue of hard work.
I will help insofar as I can.
Notwithstanding the delays, the project was completed on time.
The plan is good inasmuch as it addresses the main issues.
Henceforth, all meetings will be recorded.
She offered cash in lieu of a gift.
Rules pertaining to safety must be followed.
I have a question with regard to the schedule.
The drug works in conjunction with therapy.
I am writing on behalf of my client.
We must take all factors into account.
Bear in mind that the deadline is Friday.

cards.definition: to form an opinion after considering facts
cards.context: It is too early to draw conclusions.
The policy gave rise to widespread protests.
The research shed light on the mystery.
Success depends to a great extent on effort.

cards.definition: over a long period of time
cards.context: Investing in education pays off in the long run.
On the whole, the event was a success.

cards.definition: for the purpose of; in the interest of
cards.context: He compromised for the sake of peace.
